rev.comment: made the uncertainty about Satoshi evident
rev.diff:
Line 73: Line 73:
==Technology==
==Technology==
â
The principles of the system are described in Satoshi Nakamoto's 2008 Bitcoin whitepaper,<ref name="whitepaper" /> which was posted to a cryptography [[Electronic mailing list|e-mail list]].<ref name="wbi">{{Cite news |url=http://www.technologyreview.com/computing/37619/?p1=A1&a=f |title=What Bitcoin Is, and Why It Matters |author=Tom Simonite |accessdate=14 June 2011 |date=25 May 2011 |work=Technology Review |publisher=MIT }}</ref> Nakamoto ended<ref>[http://bitcoinstats.com/irc/bitcoin-dev/logs/2011/04/26/5#l445170 Bitcoin IRC channel log]</ref> his direct involvement with the project in late 2010. Bitcoin relies on the transfer of amounts between public accounts using [[digital signature]]s. All transactions are public and stored in a [[distributed database]] which is used to confirm transactions and prevent [[double-spending]].
+
The principles of the system are described in Satoshi Nakamoto's 2008 Bitcoin whitepaper,<ref name="whitepaper" /> which was posted to a cryptography [[Electronic mailing list|e-mail list]].<ref name="wbi">{{Cite news |url=http://www.technologyreview.com/computing/37619/?p1=A1&a=f |title=What Bitcoin Is, and Why It Matters |author=Tom Simonite |accessdate=14 June 2011 |date=25 May 2011 |work=Technology Review |publisher=MIT }}</ref> Nakamoto apparently ended<ref>[http://bitcoinstats.com/irc/bitcoin-dev/logs/2011/04/26/5#l445170 Bitcoin IRC channel log]</ref> his direct involvement with the project in late 2010. Bitcoin relies on the transfer of amounts between public accounts using [[digital signature]]s. All transactions are public and stored in a [[distributed database]] which is used to confirm transactions and prevent [[double-spending]].
